intro: Chrysanthemum mawii, commonly known as the African chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features bright yellow to orange flower heads with surrounding white or green ray florets. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and somewhat woody. Chrysanthemum mawii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
